caption:
This photograph shows an exterior view of the Irwin Union Bank building. In the foreground, there is a body of water, possibly a decorative pond or canal, reflecting parts of the scenery. A low wall with the inscription "IRWIN UNION BANK" in capital red letters is clearly visible across the water from the viewer's perspective, emphasizing the bank's name.

Behind the inscribed wall, a row of parked cars is visible. Among these, two particularly distinguishable cars are a light-colored sedan and a darker-colored coupe, both reflecting the automotive design styles likely from the 1960s or 1970s. The cars are parked on a street that runs along the bank.

The architectural style of the bank building features modernist influences with a linear design and large, evenly spaced windows. The windows show reflections and feature vertical blinds. The facade appears to be made of a light-colored brick or stone, giving the building a sturdy and formal appearance.

The environment around the bank includes well-manicured green grass, contributing to a polished and professional setting for the bank. The overall composition and elements of the scene encapsulate a typical mid-20th-century American business district atmosphere.
title: Cars line up outside drive-in teller windows.
